title: Relief teams seek aid in andes quake
author: Upi
text: CUZCO, Peru (UPI) _ Rescue workers appealed for help today to airlift supplies to remote mountain villages rocked by an earthquake that killed at least eight people and left hundreds homeless in an Andes mountain region peopled by descendants of the Incas        Archeologists in Cuzco, the regional capital in southern Peru perched high in the Andes, checked damage to Spanish colonial buildings dating back to the era shortly after the conquistadors conquered the mighty Inca Empire.        At least 11 villages were hard hit by Saturday's quake, which registered 5.8 on the Richter scale.        Relief workers said they were desperately short of supplies and only 80 tents have been found to house the estimated 600 homeless families in the Cuzco region.        In Cuzco, the quake shattered windows and cracked walls of buildings, including the cathedral dating back to 1550.        Archeologists who examined damage to buildings said it appeared that none of the Inca ruins were damaged significantly.
